Now that the days are longer and, most importantly, warmer, we’ll be spending
a lot more time out in nature. And whether you can’t wait to bury your feet in
the hot sand at the nearest beach or set up a tent in the wilderness of one of
the country’s [National Parks](https://www.travelandleisure.com/trip-
ideas/national-parks), entertainment is essential — especially if you’re
traveling with a group.  
  
This is where a good portable speaker comes in handy. They usually connect to
your iPhone or another device via Bluetooth so you can stream your favorite
Spotify playlist, whether you're at the beach or on the trail.  
  
 **Related:**[The 11 Most Comfortable Headphones to Wear on Your Next Flight,
According to Thousands of Amazon
Reviews](https://www.travelandleisure.com/style/travel-accessories/most-
comfortable-headphones)  
  
Now let’s talk specifics: what should you look for in a travel-friendly
speaker? First of all, size does matter. While you can afford to have bulkier
and heavier speakers at home, when your carry-on space is limited, those are
not really an option. There are some that weigh less than a pound and the
speaker itself can fit in the palm of your hand. But don’t worry, that doesn’t
come at the expense of quality. Brands like
[Bose](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01HETFQKS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=tlportablespeakers-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01HETFQKS&linkId=6c4ad6160993813aa4ca4c4f232665ec),
[Bang &
Olufsen](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01DO9KW38/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=tlportablespeakers-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01DO9KW38&linkId=5aa7b0371a47ad1267b9d360291640a1),
and [Ultimate Ears](https://www.amazon.com/Ultimate-Ears-Portable-Bluetooth-
Waterproof/dp/B07DD7ZJ6X/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&linkCode=ll1&tag=tllifeportablespeakersdzhekovamdiamondjun20-20&linkId=fe54bff5cd2ef0e941b7419a8553ddf7&language=en_US)
have created compact products that still deliver an extraordinary audio
experience.  
  
Another thing to look for is durability. You'll want speakers that are water-,
dust-, and sand-proof if you're going to be using them outdoors. Battery life
is also important — most speakers offer between five and 24 hours of playtime
on a single charge.  
  
Now, peruse 10 portable wireless speakers that will bring the perfect
soundtrack to your summer travels.
